intro: Clistanthocereus, commonly known as the night blooming cereus, is a genus of cacti native to the Americas. These plants are characterized by their spiny stems and showy, fragrant flowers that open at night. They are typically drought-tolerant and thrive in well-draining soil. The flowers are often white or pale pink and attract nocturnal pollinators like moths. Clistanthocereus species are popular among cactus enthusiasts for their striking appearance and unique blooming habits.
